content:
• Thursday, May 17, 2018
  • BOOT

    Boot Barn -3.6% as 7.2M-share offering said to come at $23.50-$24

    • Boot Barn (NASDAQ:BOOT) has dropped 3.6% in postmarket action after launching a 7.21M-share public offering for selling stockholders.
    • Those will go for $23.50-$24/share, a source tells Bloomberg -- about a 2-4% discount from close. Shares settled at $24.49 on Nasdaq today.
    • The stockholders include funds managed by Freeman Spogli & Co., offering its entire stake of 7,021,771 shares, and some directors who are offering 190,042 shares.
    • J.P. Morgan Securities and Jefferies are underwriters for the offering.
    • The company isn't selling shares and won't receive proceeds.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • DRNA

    Dicerna +1.7% as hyperoxaluria treatment gets orphan status from FDA

    • Dicerna Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:DRNA) is up 1.7% in late trading after getting an orphan drug status designation for its treatment for primary hyperoxaluria.
    • The FDA granted the status to Dicerna's synthetic double-stranded RNA oligonucleotide conjugated to N-acetyl-D-galactosamine aminosugar residues on Tuesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • QTNT

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (05/17/2018)

    • Top gainers: QTNT +12.1%. AFSI +6.1%. EIGR +3.5%. DRNA +3.0%. TIVO +2.0%.
    • Top Losers: JWN -6.4%. ARQL -6.3%.  STKL -5.2%. AMAT -4.7%. BOOT -3.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • ARQL

    ArQule -6.3% as it registers 10.6M shares for selling holders

    • ArQule (NASDAQ:ARQL) is 6.3% lower in postmarket trade after it filed a registration statement for up to 10.629M shares for sale by certain stockholders.
    • The share total includes 2.259M shares issuable upon the exercise of outstanding warrants.
    • The selling stockholders are Ran Nussbaum's Pontifax Group, along with the Sphera Global Healthcare Master Fund and HFR HE Sphera Global Healthcare Master Trust.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • QTNT

    Quotient Limited MosaiQ microarray starting Europe trials

    • Diagnostics firm Quotient Limited (NASDAQ:QTNT) is up 11.9% after hours following word that its initial blood grouping MosaiQ microarray has finished a verification/validation phase, and has started field trials in Europe.
    • Results of previously disclosed V&V results implied overall concordance of 99.8% for antigen typing on the MosaiQ platform.
    • The MosaiQ IH microarray antibody detection requirement is to be 95% concordant with predicate technology.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM | 2 Comments
  • VJET

    Voxeljet +7.7% despite Q1 misses,

    • Voxeljet (NYSE:VJET) shares are up 7.7% aftermarket on Q1 results that missed EPS and revenue estimates with a 12% Y/Y revenue growth. Reaffirmed FY18 guidance has revenue from €28M to €30M with gross margin above 40%.
    • Earnings call is scheduled for tomorrow morning at 8:30 AM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Voxeljet AG misses by €0.03, misses on revenue (May 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • TYHT

    Shineco reports Q3 results

    • Shineco (NASDAQ:TYHT): Q3 EPS of $0.21
    • Revenue of $13.34M (+68.0% Y/Y)
    • Shares +11.76%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment allegations 'over-hyped' by short seller, Stifel analyst says

    • AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV) reversed morning losses to finish with a hefty 5.6% gain after Stifel analyst Joseph DeNardi said he believed a whistleblower lawsuit's allegations were "over-hyped" as part of a negative report from short seller Aurelius Capital.
    • While Aurelius claims the lawsuit involves a "cover-up of illegal activity and dangerous conduct," DeNardi said the incident related to a switchblade being transported on a Delta flight and was reported to the government in detail.
    • Stifel maintains a Buy rating and $65 price target on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • AFSI

    AmTrust up nearly 7% as Icahn discloses stake

    • Carl Icahn discloses a 9.4% stake in AmTrust (NASDAQ:AFSI). In the filing, Icahn says he's opposed to the going-private deal at $13.50 per share.
    • AFSI +6.85% after hours to $14.35.
    • Letter to the board: "The Zyskind/Karfunkel families, with the help of the 'independent' Special Committee of the Board, are blatantly taking advantage of AmTrust’s minority shareholders."
    • Previously: AmTrust agrees to buyout at $13.50 per share (March 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 35 Comments
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials -2% on Q2 beats, mixed guidance

    • Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) drops 2% aftermarket on Q2 results that beat EPS and revenue results with a 29% Y/Y revenue growth. Q3 guidance has downside revenue of $4.33B to $4.53B (consensus: $4.54B) and in-line EPS of $1.13 to $1.21 (consensus: $1.16).
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP gross margin, 46.7% (+0.4 pts); operating margin, 30.2% (+2.4 pts); cash from operations, $611M; capital allocation, $2.6B; operating expenses,  $763M; cash and equivalents, $4.87B. 
    • Segment performance: Semiconductor Systems, $3B (+25% Y/Y); Applied Global Services, $943M (+30%); Display and Adjacent Markets,  $600M (+53%). 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Applied Materials beats by $0.08, beats on revenue (May 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 49 Comments
  • JWN

    Nordstrom lower after sales guidance arrives light

    • Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) reports comparable sales rose 0.6% in Q1 vs. +1.0% consensus estimate.
    • Comparable sales were up 0.7% at full-price stores and 0.4% at off-price outlets.
    • Digital sales rose 18% Y/Y to carve out 29% of all sales, compared to 25% a year ago.
    • Gross profit fell 21 bps to 34.1% of sales as higher occupancy costs nipped.
    • SG&A expenses were up 32 bps to 32.3% of sales.
    • EBIT came in at $153M or 4.4% of sales vs. $151M and 4.6% of sales a year ago.
    • Nordstom ended the quarter with 373 stores vs. 353 stores a year ago, led by a net gain of 16 Nordstrom Rack stores.
    • The company reiterates full-year revenue guidance of $15.2B to $15.4B vs. $15.64B consensus. The forecast for EBIT is trimmed just slightly to $885M to $940M from $895M to $940M and $907M consensus.
    • Shares of Nordstrom are down 5.16% in AH trading to drop back below $50.
    • Previously: Nordstrom beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (May 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 7 Comments
  • JE

    Just Energy -7% as Q1 FFO, EBITDA both decline

    • Just Energy (JE -6.8%) sinks to a 52-week low following Q4 results, as base FFO fell 11% Y/Y to $25.5M and base EBITDA fell 8% Y/Y to $69M.
    • JE cites strategic sales growth initiative investments, abnormal weather-driven supply cost increases and non-recurring severance costs for the lower Y/Y results.
    • JE provides FY 2019 base EBITDA guidance of $200M-$220M including the implementation of IFRS 15, ~10% Y/Y growth at the midpoint; FY 2018 base EBITDA would have been ~$188M when adjusted for IFRS 15.
    • "Moving forward, we’re committed to executing a strategic shift from a retail energy provider to a consumer company. As a part of our transformation objectives, our stakeholders can expect Just Energy to take the necessary measures to remove the volatility and improve the transparency in our results," the company says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • SQ

    Square tracks lower with PayPal stalking iZettle

    • Shares of Square (NYSE:SQ) are down 2.6% after Sky News tips that PayPal may be acquiring iZettle.
    • Square is off its session low of $54.60.
    • Previously: PayPal said to be pursuing iZettle (May 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 32 Comments
  • CVE

    Cenovus Energy +3% as BMO upgrades, citing rising cash flow outlook

    • Cenovus Energy (CVE +2.9%) is sharply higher after BMO Capital upgrades shares to Outperform from Market Perform with a $17 price target, raised from $15, as stronger oil prices help repair the company's balance sheet, especially as "the low oil price hedges roll off" during the remainder of 2018.
    • BMO believes "rising free cash flow and a deleveraged balance sheet could support a positive re-rating of Cenovus's valuation multiples," and the firm raises its 2018 cash flow/share forecast to $1.66 from $1.65 and its 2019 estimate to $2.91 from $2.89.
    • Helped by the lower-priced hedges beginning to dissipate, as well as higher production, the firm thinks CVE likely will generate $5.8B in surplus cash flow over the 2018-22 period.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 41 Comments
  • CPSH

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (05/17/2018)

    • Gainers: CPSH +21%. BBOX +19%. PCYG +8%. RVLT +8%. ISNS +7%.
    • Losers: KEM -12%. HEAR -9%. NIHD -9%. NTES -8%. BLIN -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • ITUB

    Brazil banks fall after central bank keeps interest rate unchanged

    • Itau Unibanco Holding (ITUB -4.9%),Banco Santander Brasil (BSBR -2.4%), and Banco Bradesco (BBD -4.3%) all slid after Brazil's central bank unexpectedly kept its benchmark Selic rate unchanged at 6.50%.
    • The bank's monetary policy committee says inflation developments remain favorable, "with various measures of underlying inflation running still at low levels," the bank said in a statement.
    • It expects 2018 inflation at about 3.5%, rising to 4.0% in 2019 and 2020.
    • The committee says its scenario assumes a path for policy interest rate that ends this year at 6.5% p.a., and 2019 at 8.0% p.a.
    • Previously: Bloomberg: Investors in Brazil turn bearish, BofA ML survey finds (May 15)
    • ETFs: EWZ, BRZU, BZQ, BZF, UBR, DBBR, FBZ
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • CSCO

    Baird still bullish on Cisco after 'solid' Q3 report

    • Investors may not like the guidance in Cisco's (NASDAQ:CSCO) Q3 earnings report -- shares are 3.5% lower and hit their lowest point in a month -- but Baird's Jayson Noland is sticking with bullishness.
    • The report was "solid" and reinforced a view that the company's "increasingly well positioned" for differentiation, Noland writes.
    • He has an Outperform rating and reiterates a $51 price target, now representing 17% upside.
    • Earnings call slides
    • Earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 11 Comments
  • INTC

    Intel's self-driving cars testing in Jerusalem

    • Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) and its Mobileye subsidiary have started testing self-driving vehicles in Jerusalem.
    • The fleet includes 100 cars, and each has 12 cameras for a 360-degree view. Eight of the cameras are for long-range viewing and four for parking. The companies will add a layer of LIDAR and radar in the next few weeks. 
    • The company plans to deploy the fleet in the US and other regions in the “coming months.” 
    • Intel hopes to have self-driving vehicles on the road by 2021 in partnership with vehicle manufacturers.  
    • Intel shares are up 0.2% to $54.74.
    • Previously: Big self-driving car deal for Mobileye (May 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 18 Comments
  • MLNX

    Benchmark upgrades Mellanox after guidance update

    • Benchmark raises its Mellanox Tech (NASDAQ:MLNX) price target from $95 to $100 after today’s guidance update.
    • Source: Briefing.com. 
    • Mellanox shares are up 3.1% to $87.55.  
    • Previously: Mellanox Tech +5.2% on raised Q2, FY guidance (May 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • JACK

    Post-earnings slump for Jack in the Box

    • Jack in the Box (NASDAQ:JACK) is down 8.03% after the company reports disappointing earnings and pushes off issuing long-term guidance until August as the post-Qdoba arrangements become clearer.
    • The restaurant operator says it has engaged an outside firm to help it identify cost-savings opportunities and analyzing new financing structures.
    • Previously: Comparable sales miss at Jack in the Box (May 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • XNET

    Xunlei unveils products for 'blockchain ecosystem'

    • Xunlei Limited (XNET -1.9%) has announced developments in blockchain infrastructure it says are products to build a blockchain ecosystem.
    • StellarCloud is a shared platform designed to extend its existing content delivery network services to Infrastructure as a Service; it's intended to help companies in their transition to cloud services.
    • Coinciding with that announcement, it said iQiyi (IQ -1.1%) had joined in a strategic cooperation deal regarding StellarCloud.
    • Meanwhile, Xunlei says ThunderChain is high-performance blockchain infrastructure that can hit more than a million transactions per second.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 13 Comments
  • TEUM

    Pareteum in $3M, three-year deal with security service provider

    • Pareteum's (TEUM -1.8%) latest contract win is a $3M cloud contract with an established UK-based enterprise.
    • The contract for Pareteum's Global Cloud Services Platform is a three-year deal, set with a customr who provides global security services (including home, fire and security monitoring) in more than 90 countries, along with employment screening, facilities management and enhanced tactical operations.
    • Pareteum will get monthly revenue for each connected device; the customer has more than 30,000 subscribers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 5 Comments

  • IMGN

    ImmunoGen's mirventuximab soravtansine shows positive effect in early-stage ovarian cancer study

    • ImmunoGen's (IMGN -2%) antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) mirvetuximab soravtansine, in multiple combinations, showed a treatment in benefit in a Phase 1b clinical trial, FORWARD II, in patients with folate receptor alpha-positive ovarian cancer.
    • Data from a cohort of platinum-resistant patients who received mirvetuximab soravtansine + Roche's Avastin (bevacizumab) will be presented at ASCO in Chicago.
    • In 54 evaluable patients, the overall response rate (ORR) was 43% (n=23) with median progression-free survival (PFS) of 7.8 months. Patients received a median of three prior lines of therapy with 58% receiving prior treatment with Avastin.
    • In a subset of 23 evaluable patients with medium/high folate receptor alpha expression levels who received up to three prior lines of therapy, the ORR was 48% and median PFS was 9.9 months.
    • The confirmed ORR was 80% (n=8/10) in a subset of platinum-sensitive ovarian cancer patients treated with mirventuximab soravtansine + carboplatin.
    • Mirvetuximab soravtansine is an ADC that targets folate receptor alpha.
    • #ASCO18
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • CARV

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (05/17/2018)

    • Gainers: CARV +82%. DS +11%. OPHC +8%. MFIN +7%.
    • Losers: FPAY -17%. CIFS -11%.

    | 1:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • ZAYO

    Zayo +1.3% on communications infrastracture deal

    • Zayo Group Holdings (NYSE:ZAYO) announces a global business process outsourcing company selected its integrated communications infrastructure.  
    • Zayo will provide over 80 cabinets of colocation space in a data center on the East Coast.
    • Terms not disclosed but it is a multiyear deal. 
    • Zayo shares are up 1.3% to $34.01.  
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • CNIT-OLD

    CNIT announces $1M ad terminal sales

    • China Information Technology (NASDAQ:CNIT-OLD) announces entering contracts to sell 3K cloud-based elevator ad terminals in office and residential buildings in Qingyuan.
    • CNIT expects the contracts to generate sales and service revenue of about $1M.   
    • CNIT shares are down 1.7% to $1.74.    
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • REGN

    Regeneron and Sanofi's cemiplimab shows positive effect in early-stage lung cancer study

    • Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN +0.7%) and development partner Sanofi (SNY +0.9%) announce positive preliminary data from a Phase 1 clinical trial assessing cemiplimab in advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). The results will be presented at ASCO in Chicago.
    • The overall response rate was 29% (n=6/21), all partial, and the disease control rate (responders + those with stable cancer) was 57% (n=12/21) as of the data cutoff date. Duration of response exceeded eight months in five of the six responders.
    • Regeneron's U.S. marketing application seeking approval for cemiplimab, a PD-1 inhibitor, for cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma is currently under FDA review with an action date of October 28.
    • Previously: Regeneron and Sanofi's cemiplimab nabs accelerated review in U.S. for type of skin cancer (April 30)
    • #ASCO18
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 7 Comments
  • ENS

    Enersys +8% after Q1 beat, upside earnings guidance

    • EnerSys (ENS +8%) surges to its highest in 11 months after Q4 earnings and revenues edge analyst estimates as sales of premium products topped 40% of total company sales for the first time.
    • ENS issues upside guidance for Q1, seeing EPS of $1.15-$1.19 vs. $1.13 analyst consensus estimate, saying that while lead and other commodities continued to rise during most of Q4, the spot rate has since declined more than 10%, which should benefit results.
    • ENS also expects FY 2018 adjusted net earnings of $4.65/share, compared to prior year adjusted net earnings of $4.75, largely due to an unfavorable tax impact of $80.9M, or $1.88/share.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • EPAM

    EPAM Systems +1.7% on target increase to 17% upside

    • Cowen maintains an Outperform rating on EPAM Systems (NYSE:EPAM) but raises the price target by $15 to $145.
    • New target represents a 17% upside to yesterday’s close. 
    • EPAM shares are up 1.7% to $125.68.

    CPS Technologies announces $29M agreements

    • CPS Technologies (NASDAQ:CPSH) announces receiving sourcing and pricing agreements with key customers for $29M over two years
    • The agreements relate to the use of AISiC baseplates in traction and HEV/EV markets.

  • CNQ

    Canadian Natural +2.5% on plan to buy back up to 5% of shares outstanding

    • Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ +2.5%) is higher after announcing plans for a normal course issuer bid for purchase for cancellation of as many as ~61.4M shares, or 5% of all outstanding common shares.
    • CNQ says it has acquired 702.7K shares for cancellation under its current normal course issuer bid, which authorized the repurchase of nearly 28M common shares.
    • CNQ cites returns to shareholders as a company priority, in addition to further strengthening its balance sheet, investing in exploration and development of its diverse asset base, and participating in acquisition opportunities.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 6 Comments
  • CBS

    CBS -6.2% as judge denies restraining order in re-merger fight

    • CBS is on the slide, down 6.2%, after the Redstone family wins a key court decision in their fight with the broadcaster over a potential re-merger with Viacom (VIA +0.7%, VIAB -0.2%).
    • The court denied a CBS bid to stop National Amusements and Shari Redstone from interfering with today's CBS board meeting, saying the broadcaster failed to show irreparable harm.
    • A temporary restraining order that CBS sought was denied, THR's Eriq Gardner reports.
    • That means Redstone can block a CBS board vote that would dilute NAI's voting power and thus its control of CBS.
    • Updated 12:04 p.m.: It's not the last showdown of the day, as a CBS statement says the board is meeting at 5 p.m. as scheduled and will consider declaring the dilutive dividend "as is permitted under CBS' charter. This dividend would more closely align economic and voting interests of CBS stockholders without diluting the economic interests of any stockholder." NAI rewrote CBS bylaws yesterday to call for a board supermajority in such votes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 31 Comments
  • NGG

    National Grid +3% as full-year yearly profit pops 24%

    • National Grid (NGG +3.3%) is sharply higher after reporting a 24% Y/Y increase in its FY 2018 pretax profit and expresses optimism about its growth prospects.
    • NGG says it expects growth in its business of at least 7% in the near term and at the top end of its 5%-7% guidance range for the medium term as the U.S. business should continue performing well while the U.K. business remains on track to outperform.
    • NGG says its pretax profit for the fiscal year ended March 31 totaled €2.71B ($3.66B) vs. €2.18B a year earlier, while FY 2018 revenues rose to €15.25B compared with €15.04B in FY 2017 and analyst consensus estimate of €15.07B; net profit from continuing operations was €2.06B vs. €1.81B a year earlier and €2.04B consensus.
    • Full-year profit from NGG's regulated business in the U.S., which contributes about half of the total, fell slightly to €1.7B but edged analyst consensus of €1.66B.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 6 Comments
  • FARM

    Farmer Brothers seen as possible Cott target

    • Farmer Brothers (NASDAQ:FARM) is up 4.3% in what could be a delayed reaction to RBC analyst Nik Mondi's prediction that the company could be acquired by Cott (COT -1.1%) if shares fall off again.
    • Shares of Farmer Brothers are down 17% YTD.
    • Sources: Bloomberg, Marketwatch
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • TTWO

    Take-Two rebounds as analysts look ahead at key games

    • Take-Two Interactive (NASDAQ:TTWO) has rebounded from last night's post-earnings declines, settling in for 2% gains currently after hitting a 3.5-month high this morning.
    • The company guided low and missed on revenues, and a key release (Borderlands 3) was pushed off into the next fiscal year, but Jefferies is more focused on the high-profile release of Red Dead Redemption 2 (coming this fall after its own delay).
    • "It was a messy quarter with a lot of moving parts," analyst Timothy O'Shea says, with revenues likely dinged not only by rival game Fortnite but also by NBA 2K sales that were lighter than expected. Still, his bottom line is to own the stock
    • Baird's Colin Sebastian is largely of the same mind, looking past Fortnite competition to the RDR2 release. Competition from Fortnite and PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds still had its impact, though, given Take-Two's dependence on recurring revenues.
    • KeyBanc stayed Overweight as well, raising its price target to $152. A more cautious Cowen rates the stock Market Perform with a $96 target, with "significant" growth of its key franchises fully priced in already.
    • Big rivals were down in lockstep during last night's postmarket action, but they're higher alongside Take-Two today: ATVI +1.7%; EA +0.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 27 Comments
  • BZUN

    Baozun +18.6% on Q1 beats, 16% Y/Y revenue growth

    • Baozun (NASDAQ:BZUN) pops 18.6% on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 16% Y/Y revenue growth. Q2 guidance has services revenue growing over 50%Y/Y.
    • Key metrics: Services revenue, $73.5M (+50% Y/Y); operating margin, 5% (+0.8 pts); operating expenses, $142.3M; cash and equivalents, $113.1M.
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Baozun beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (May 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 49 Comments
  • DLNG

    Dynagas LNG Partners up 2% post Q1 results

    • Dynagas LNG Partners (DLNG +1.6%) reports Q1 revenue decrease of 13.3% Y/Y to $33.9M; this decrease was driven by the lower revenues earned on the Clean Energy.
    • Q1 overall margins: Operating income declined 645 bps to 49.5%; Adj. EBITDA declined 185 bps to 78.5%.
    • Distributable cash flow was $11.3M; cash & equivalent of $61.4M (-9% Q/Q) & available liquidity was $91.4M
    • Number of vessels were 6; Calendar & Available days of 540; Vessel daily operating expenses was $11,741 (-5.6% Y/Y); Time Charter Equivalent of $61,635 (-13% Y/Y) & Fleet Utilization of 100%.
    • The company declared cash dividend of $0.25 per share.
    • Previously: Dynagas LNG Partners LP beats by $0.01, misses on revenue (May 16)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • TK

    Teekay -7% on wider than expected Q1 loss, warning on tanker rates

    • Teekay Corp. (TK -7.7%) falls as much as 16% for its largest intraday drop since June 2017 after reporting a wider than expected Q1 loss and warning that its Teekay Tankers (TNK -4.7%) subsidiary may face weak tanker rates for most of this year.
    • “While tanker rates are expected to remain weak in the near-term, we are anticipating a gradual improvement in fleet utilization and tanker rates from late-2018," TK CEO Kenneth Hvid says.

  • SNDX

    Syndax down 22% on mid-stage entinostat data

    • Thinly traded micro cap Syndax Pharmaceuticals (SNDX -21.9%) slumps on more than double normal volume in apparent response to the release of updated results from the ongoing Phase 2 ENCORE 601 study assessing entinostat + Merck's Keytruda (pembrolizumab) across a range of cancers, including NSCLC, melanoma and microsatellite stable CRC.
    • The response rate was 11% (n=6/57) in NSCLC patients who had received prior treatment with a PD-1/L1 inhibitor + chemo. Median duration of response was 4.6 months.
    • The company says it has identified subgroup of NSCLC patients with elevated monocytes (type of white blood cell) that demonstrated a 29% response rate (n=4/14) and longer duration of response (progression-free survival = 5.4 months) compared to third-line chemo after PD-1(L)1 + platinum doublet therapy (2.8 months). It plans to launch a pivotal study in this patient population by year-end.
    • In the PD-1 treatment-experienced melanoma group, the combination produced an 18% confirmed response rate with a median duration of response of 9.1 months.
    • Previously: Syndax Pharma reports study results that support treatment benefit of entinostat, investors unmoved after Nektar data, shares down 11% (Nov. 13, 2017)

    Valero Energy spikes 5% on Morgan Stanley upgrade, refining optimism

    • Valero Energy (VLO +4.9%) surges to a 52-week high Morgan Stanley upgrades shares to Overweight from Equal Weight with a $140 price target, raised from $110, as the shift in global oil supply towards light oil and regulations to control pollution should drive strong returns for complex refiners.
    • Stanley analyst Benny Wong says recent underinvestment in refining, reductions in capacity additions and overstated concerns about long-term demand have set the stage for refining to enter a "golden age" through 2020.
    • Demand for jet fuel, mining, chemicals and heavy transport are "here to stay" while the world is falling short by about one refinery annually until 2020, Wong says.
    • Stanley considers VLO and Marathon Petroleum (MPC +4.4%) its top U.S. picks in the refining space; the firm raises its price target on MPC to $100 from $90.
